verses.roman:
śuniyā rājāra mane duḥkha upajila
viṣāda kariyā kichu kahite lāgila

synonyms: śuniyā—hearing; rājāra—of the King; mane—in the mind; duḥkha—unhappiness; upajila—arose; viṣāda—lamentation; kariyā—doing; kichu—something; kahite—to speak; lāgila—began.
translation: Hearing this, the King became very unhappy and, greatly lamenting, began to speak as follows.
